newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela sets 100 bln bolivar TEM auction Wed.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela sets 100 bln bolivar TEM auction Wed.

text.p: The Central Bank of Venezuela announced for Wednesday morning a 60 billion bolivar ($126 million) auction of 178-day "monetary stabilization," or TEM, bills with a 18.81 percent coupon.
The bank said it would also offer 20 billion bolivars ($42 million) in 267-day bills with a 19.24 percent coupon, and another 20 billion bolivars of 358-day bills with a 19.70 percent coupon.
Some 80 billion bolivars of TEMs will mature on Thursday and Friday.

Coupons at the Wednesday auction are up from last week's 100 billion bolivar issue. Then 179-, 269- and 360-day notes carried 16.26, 16.58, and 16.92 percent coupons respectively for effective yields that rose as much as 266 basis points along the curve to 18.81, 19.73 and 21.26 percent.
The weekly TEM bill auctions are the Central Bank's principal tool of monetary policy, used to restrict liquidity and establish a benchmark for wider interest rates.
